--- title: "Individual Participant Data Meta-analysis of clinical trials and real-world data" authors: - name: Pablo Verde affiliations: - ref: umcdusseldorf - name: Thomas Debray orcid: 0000-0002-1790-2719 affiliations: - ref: smartdas affiliations: - id: smartdas name: Smart Data Analysis and Statistics B.V. city: Utrecht - id: umcdusseldorf name: Universitätsklinikum Düsseldorf city: Düsseldorf format: html: toc: true number-sections: true execute: cache: true bibliography: 'https://api.citedrive.com/bib/0d25b38b-db8f-43c4-b934-f4e2f3bd655a/references.bib?x=eyJpZCI6ICIwZDI1YjM4Yi1kYjhmLTQzYzQtYjkzNC1mNGUyZjNiZDY1NWEiLCAidXNlciI6ICIyNTA2IiwgInNpZ25hdHVyZSI6ICI0MGFkYjZhMzYyYWE5Y2U0MjQ2NWE2ZTQzNjlhMWY3NTk5MzhhNzUxZDNjYWIxNDlmYjM4NDgwOTYzMzY5YzFlIn0=/bibliography.bib' --- ## Introduction ## Adjuvant therapies for diabetes In this example, we consider the synthesis of the following data: * Aggregate data from 35 randomized trials investigating the effectiveness of adjuvant therapies for diabetic patients, and * Individual participant data from a prospective cohort study investigating patient and limb survival in patients with diabetic foot ulcers We first retrieve the randomized evidence. ::: {.cell hash='chapter_11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_afb3b0f2543585984d7b78d2023c7ef9'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) library(jarbes) data("healing") AD <- healing %>% dplyr::select(y_c, n_c, y_t, n_t, Study) names(AD) <- c("yc", "nc", "yt", "nt", "Study") ``` ::: The corresponding aggregate data are depicted below: ::: {.cell hash='chapter_11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_5e2df8f55ca7aaca1a159917accd1328'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Study yc nc yt nt
Veves_2002 39 138 51 138
Jude_2007 15 67 21 67
Niezgoda_2005 10 36 18 37
Jeffcoate_2009 46 103 48 108
Harkless_2005 100 150 99 139
Van_de_Weg_2008 6 20 6 23
Bouter_1996 6 24 4 22
Hardikar_2005 18 58 39 54
Lipsky_2008 377 417 363 418
Lipsky_2005_1 39 56 31 47
Robson_2005 25 72 31 74
Afshari_2005 2 20 7 30
Tsang_2003 15 19 32 42
Viswanathan_2006 14 28 25 29
Duzgun_2008 0 50 33 50
Kessler_2003 0 13 2 15
Katz_2005 15 20 17 21
Marston_2003 21 115 39 130
Naughton_1997 40 126 42 109
Pham_1999 7 17 12 16
Veves_2001 36 96 63 112
Blume_2008 48 166 73 169
Moretti_2009 5 15 8 15
Peters_2001 7 20 13 20
Ganguly_2008 21 26 28 29
Driver_2006 9 21 13 19
Reyzelman_2009 18 39 32 47
Kalani_2003 9 43 14 44
deLalla_2001 7 20 7 20
Kastenbauer_2003 0 17 0 20
Abidia_2003 1 8 5 8
Londahl_2010 12 45 25 49
Steed_1995 2 25 14 40
Mueller_1989 6 19 19 21
Piagessi_2001 9 10 10 10
````` ::: ::: Subsequently, we retrieve the individual participant data: ::: {.cell hash='chapter_11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_98abfdc985b108064e02e2f47ea3d856'} ```{.r .cell-code} data("healingipd") IPD <- healingipd %>% dplyr::select(healing.without.amp, PAD, neuropathy, first.ever.lesion, no.continuous.care, male, diab.typ2, insulin, HOCHD, HOS, CRF, dialysis, DNOAP, smoking.ever, diabdur, wagner.class) ``` ::: Briefly, these IPD were obtained from a prospective cohort study enrolling consecutive patients with diabetic foot ulcers (DFUs) and without previous major amputation in a single diabetes center between June 1998 and December 1999. The baseline characteristics of the study population is summarized below: ::: {.cell hash='chapter_11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_e3cccdb8115a1ff5b26edf11cfd5b38f'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Overall
(N=260)
Age (years)
Mean (SD) 68.9 (10.9)
Median [Min, Max] 70.0 [25.0, 91.0]
Sex
Female 106 (40.8%)
Male 154 (59.2%)
Ever smoker
Yes 154 (59.2%)
No 106 (40.8%)
Diabetes duration (years)
Mean (SD) 15.9 (10.6)
Median [Min, Max] 14.0 [0, 53.0]
Diabetes type 2
Yes 229 (88.1%)
No 31 (11.9%)
Peripheral arterial disease
Yes 148 (56.9%)
No 112 (43.1%)
Neuropathy
Yes 224 (86.2%)
No 36 (13.8%)
First ever lesion
Yes 114 (43.8%)
No 146 (56.2%)
No continuous care
Yes 177 (68.1%)
No 83 (31.9%)
Insulin dependent
Yes 174 (66.9%)
No 86 (33.1%)
History of coronary events (CHD)
Yes 52 (20.0%)
No 208 (80.0%)

Yes 55 (21.2%)
No 205 (78.8%)
Charcot foot syndrome
Yes 52 (20.0%)
No 208 (80.0%)

Yes 9 (3.5%)
No 251 (96.5%)
DNOAP

No 231 (88.8%)
Wagner score
1-2 142 (54.6%)
3-4-5 118 (45.4%)
``` ::: ::: We prepare the relevant aggregate data, and subsequently conduct a meta-analysis to analyse heterogeneity of the treatment effect as a function of the baseline risk ::: {.cell hash='chapter_11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_0ca44c42d0ffe19dbc608df7f3e28db6'} ```{.r .cell-code} m.0 <- metarisk(data = AD) summary(m.0) ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='chapter_11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_6b0d1cd32859ef990f37f55c5b1146bd'} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Model specification: Random effects: normal Link function: logit Fixed effects: mean sd 2.5% 25% 50% 75% 97.5% Rhat n.eff mu.1 -0.598 0.237 -1.071 -0.753 -0.597 -0.441 -0.131 1.001 3500 mu.2 0.777 0.165 0.457 0.667 0.775 0.884 1.108 1.001 18000 intercept 0.675 0.167 0.353 0.565 0.671 0.784 1.009 1.001 13000 slope -0.167 0.118 -0.400 -0.245 -0.167 -0.090 0.065 1.002 1400 Odds.pool 0.662 0.037 0.587 0.638 0.662 0.687 0.733 1.001 12000 P_control.pool 0.357 0.054 0.255 0.320 0.355 0.392 0.467 1.001 3900 Random effects: mean sd 2.5% 25% 50% 75% 97.5% Rhat n.eff sigma.1 1.335 0.206 0.992 1.189 1.317 1.457 1.800 1.001 18000 sigma.2 0.758 0.157 0.496 0.648 0.744 0.853 1.106 1.001 16000 rho -0.294 0.194 -0.642 -0.434 -0.306 -0.164 0.109 1.002 1300 ------------------- Predictive effects: mean sd 2.5% 25% 50% 75% 97.5% Rhat n.eff Odds.new 0.667 0.157 0.315 0.569 0.686 0.785 0.916 1.001 18000 P_control.new 0.390 0.244 0.035 0.183 0.356 0.571 0.889 1.001 18000 ------------------- MCMC setup (fit using jags): 2 chains, each with 10000 iterations (first 1000 discarded) DIC: 413.433 pD: 78.919 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='chapter_11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_bf24e65d14361f8961e81d1e10009def'} ```{.r .cell-code} OR <- mean(m.0$BUGSoutput$sims.matrix[,"Odds.pool"]) CI95 <- quantile(m.0$BUGSoutput$sims.matrix[,"Odds.pool"], probs = c(0.025, 0.975)) ``` :::
